channel.title: Port Fowarding
channel.description:
Please read all of this.
[b]Port Forwarding[/b] - Generally forwarding is done so the outside world can connect to some type of server that is located behind your router/firewall... Rs Private servers (pur3pkscape) Web servers, ftp servers, mail servers, computers running telnet, ssh, remote desktop, sql, and mysql are all examples where forwarding would be needed. If you are trying to forward the same application to two different ip addresses, you may have problems lol..
[b]Port Triggering[/b]- I don't know alot about Port Triggering, But I can still help you. [url=http://www.informatione.gmxhome.de/DDWRT/Standard/V23final/help/HTrigger.html]http://www.informatione.gmxhome.de/DDWRT/Standard/V23final/help/HTrigger.html[/url] Port Triggering, mmk?
[b] Firewall[/b]- Firewalls, in general, protect you from malicious Internet attacks. These attacks can come from the outside or the inside. Outside attacks are people trying to get into your network so that they can take control of your computers, or use your computers to do things on the Internet. Inside attacks are software that has already been installed on your computer trying connect out to the Internet, usually to get instructions from an Internet hacker. By blocking both incoming and outgoing traffic, a firewall protects you from both of these kinds of attacks. [img]http://img520.imageshack.us/img520/8067/firewalltointernetyi6.jpg[/img] You could go to Control Panel, and click Secerity. You will be seeing things on firewalls.
[b]Wireless Network (securing)[/b] When setting up a wireless network, it is important to turn on as much security as you can for that network. The security settings in most routers are confusing. But if you have Linksys.. It's pretty dang easy. [img]http://img114.imageshack.us/img114/3259/5xilm3mgc6.jpg[/img] To login, leave the username and type "admin" for the password.
[b]Static IP:[/b] Get your infomation on that right here. [url=http://searchvb.techtarget.com/sDefinition/0,,sid8_gci520967,00.html]http://searchvb.techtarget.com/sDefinition/0,,sid8_gci520967,00.html[/url] Static IP Help..

item.description:
@pur3_pik3r_9 wrote:

Please read all of this.

Port Forwarding - Generally forwarding is done so the outside world can connect to some type of server that is located behind your router/firewall… Rs Private servers (pur3pkscape) Web servers, ftp servers, mail servers, computers running telnet, ssh, remote desktop, sql, and mysql are all examples where forwarding would be needed. If you are trying to forward the same application to two different ip addresses, you may have problems lol…

Port Triggering- I don’t know alot about Port Triggering, But I can still help you.
http://www.informatione.gmxhome.de/DDWRT/Standard/V23final/help/HTrigger.html Port Triggering, mmk?

Firewall- Firewalls, in general, protect you from malicious Internet attacks. These attacks can come from the outside or the inside.
Outside attacks are people trying to get into your network so that they can take control of your computers, or use your computers to do things on the Internet.
Inside attacks are software that has already been installed on your computer trying connect out to the Internet, usually to get instructions from an Internet hacker.
By blocking both incoming and outgoing traffic, a firewall protects you from both of these kinds of attacks.

You could go to Control Panel, and click Secerity. You will be seeing things on firewalls.

Wireless Network (securing)
When setting up a wireless network, it is important to turn on as much security as you can for that network. The security settings in most routers are confusing.
But if you have Linksys… It’s pretty dang easy.

To login, leave the username and type “admin” for the password.
